sub_title: Programme coordinator BSc Molecular Science & Technology at TU Delft | PhD
summary: With a curious personality and a strong analytical mindset, I thoroughly enjoy dissecting complicated research questions, as well as tackling organisational challenges. Having worked as a researcher in chemistry for several years, both as a PhD candidate at Leiden University, and as a postdoctoral researcher at the TU Delft, I currently work as a programme coordinator for the joint chemistry bachelor programme of the two universities: Molecular Science & Technology.

profile_positions.description: Programme coordinator for the bachelor degree Molecular Science & Technology (MST), a joint degree in chemistry and chemical engineering between the TU Delft and Leiden University
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Postdoctoral researcher working in the group of prof. dr. Arjan Houtepen (Optoelectronic Materials, Department of Chemical Engineering) on the development of luminescent nanocrystals for application in luminescent solar concentrators (LSCs), an NWO-funded LIFT project in collaboration with PHYSEE.

Part-time junior teacher (April 2022 - Jan 2023), working on redevelopment of the laboratory courses in the bachelor Molecular Science & Technology, focusing on improvement of the course organization and academic writing training.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Thesis: Photo-activation of ruthenium-decorated upconverting nanoparticles
Graduation: 17 Dec 2018 
Advisors: dr. Sylvestre Bonnet and prof. dr. Lies Bouwman

Tasks and responsibilities:
•	Design and synthesis of photo-activatable ruthenium complexes and upconverting nanoparticles (UCNPs), and assembly of supramolecular ruthenium-decorated UCNPs
•	Chemical and physical analysis of synthetic products, using a wide range of analytical methods; photochemical study of nanomaterials and photolabile compounds, including time-resolved experiments
•	Presentations at multiple (inter)national conferences, via both oral and poster presentations (two poster prizes), and writing of a doctoral thesis and several peer-reviewed scientific articles
•	Supervision of BSc and MSc students, responsible for consumables orders, lab management, and training of colleagues in optical spectroscopy techniques
•	International collaboration with multiple other research groups, and two short-term scientific missions in Italy
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description: Supervising and assisting 1st year students in Bio Pharmaceutical Sciences during their Practical Course in Organic Chemistry, as well as tutoring students during Organic Chemistry problem sessions.
profile_positions.title: Teaching assistant

profile_positions.description: The Education Committee consists of both students and teachers involved in the course MSc Chemistry. The committee is responsible for course evaluations and quality control.
profile_positions.title: Member Education Committee MSc Chemistry

profile_positions.description: Erasmus exchange internship at the School of Chemistry at the University of Nottingham. Working in the group of prof. Champness.
profile_positions.title: Erasmus Intern

profile_positions.description: Bartender/waiter in a large Belgian Beer Cafe in the city centre of Leiden. Activities also include giving beer tastings for guests and beer tasting/training for personnel.
profile_positions.title: Bartender Belgian Beer Cafe Olivier Leiden

company.name: Stichting Reünisten van De Blauwe Schuit

volunteer_experiences.description: Board member for the foundation for ex-members of the Leiden student sailing club ALSZV De Blauwe Schuit
Member of the water polo committee of the largest water polo club in the Netherlands, ZVL-1886. Responsible for referees and disciplinary cases (tuchtzaken).

volunteer_experiences.role: Treasurer, sailing instructor, and committee member
volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Fulltime board member (treasurer, 2009 – 2010) for the Leiden student sailing club, responsible for all financial matters within the club, as well as management of the club’s bar. 
•	Sailing instructor for students (aged 18-30, 2010 – 2016) in open keelboats.
•	Member and chairman of several committees (2007 – 2016), including the Advisory Board, Financial Auditing Committee, and Bar Committee.

VNSZ Nestor is the Dutch national student sailing association. Its goals are to represent and unite Dutch student sailors and the thirteen student sailing clubs in The Netherlands. My primary activities included the general management of the association, and the organisation and chairing of meetings between representatives of member clubs and seminars.
